etymology.description: 臼(臼) (jiù, "a pair of hands") + 廾(廾) (gǒng, "a pair of hands") = two pairs of hands working together -> both hands of two people
etymology.interpretation: The character combines two different components both representing hands, emphasizing the idea of cooperation or shared effort between two people.

examples.chinese: 老李和老张合力舁木材(老李和老張合力舁木材)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎo Lǐ hé Lǎo Zhāng hé lì yú mùcái.
examples.english: Old Li and Old Zhang work together to carry lumber.

examples.chinese: 村民舁着新修的石板路(村民舁著新修的石板路)，迎接远方客人(迎接遠方客人)。
examples.pinyin: Cūnmín yú zhe xīn xiū de shíbǎn lù, yíngjiē yuǎnfāng kèrén.
examples.english: Villagers carry the newly renovated stone pavement, welcoming guests from afar.
